bug.author: cheyang
bug.summary: Why the same tiered layer data are not loaded in order
bug.description:
Alluxio Version: 2.1.0-snapshot Describe the bug I put all the data in the same tiered layer: <denchmark-code>-Dalluxio.worker.tieredstore.levels=1 -Dalluxio.worker.tieredstore.level0.alias=MEM -Dalluxio.worker.tieredstore.level0.dirs.mediumtype=MEM,SSD -Dalluxio.worker.tieredstore.level0.dirs.path=/dev/shm,/var/lib/docker/alluxio-ssd -Dalluxio.worker.tieredstore.level0.dirs.quota=40GB,50GB -Dalluxio.worker.tieredstore.level0.watermark.high.ratio=0.95 -Dalluxio.worker.tieredstore.level0.watermark.low.ratio=0.7 </denchmark-code>
My assumption is that all the data will be put into MEM layer /dev/shm, then SSD /var/lib/docker/alluxio-ssd But during loading the data, I've found it looks /dev/shm and /var/lib/docker/alluxio-ssd are loaded at the same time. <denchmark-code>[root@iZhp3b4qysu7phen3sah9sZ shm]# du -sh /var/lib/docker/alluxio-ssd/ 18G /var/lib/docker/alluxio-ssd/ [root@iZhp3b4qysu7phen3sah9sZ shm]# du -sh /dev/shm/alluxioworker/ 7.7G /dev/shm/alluxioworker/ </denchmark-code>
To Reproduce Steps to reproduce the behavior (as minimally and precisely as possible) Expected behavior A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen. Urgency Describe the impact and urgency of the bug. Additional context Add any other context about the problem here.

comments.comment: hey <denchmark-link:https://github.com/cheyang>@cheyang</denchmark-link> , Alluxio uses a block allocator to determine where a block should go. The block allocator is specified by property and the default value is which will write data to the storage location with most free space. You can try using to write blocks to the first available tier with enough space.
This is not a defect, will close the issue unless some other information is provided.
